intro: Thlaspi cornuticarpum, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Thlaspi cornuticarpum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and along roadsides.
